title: JavaScript Fundamentals
description: Test your knowledge of JavaScript basics including variables, functions, and ES6 features.

questions.question_text: What is the correct way to declare a variable in JavaScript ES6?

options.text: Both B and C are correct

questions.explanation: In ES6, both 'let' and 'const' are proper ways to declare variables, with 'let' for mutable variables and 'const' for immutable ones.

questions.question_text: Which of the following are valid JavaScript data types?
questions.explanation: JavaScript has String, Number, and Boolean as primitive data types. There is no separate Character type - characters are just strings of length 1.

questions.question_text: What does 'this' keyword refer to in JavaScript?

options.text: The object that owns the method being called

questions.explanation: The 'this' keyword refers to the object that owns the method being called, though its value can change based on how the function is called.

questions.question_text: Which method is used to add an element to the end of an array?
questions.explanation: The push() method adds one or more elements to the end of an array and returns the new length of the array.
